definition[0]: if something such as money is recoverable, you can get it back after it has been lost or spent
example[0]: Some of the funds may be recoverable, or their loss may be covered by insurance.
definition[1]: if damages or costs are recoverable, a court can order them to be paid to someone
example[1]: In this case punitive damages are recoverable.
definition[2]: recoverable oil, gold etc can be taken from under the ground or sea
example[2]: There might be as much as a billion barrels of recoverable oil in the field.
